name: MythicGM
description: MythicGM Brings the rules from the Mythic game system to ANY preexisting system. Making your game not require a GM to run the story. For more informaiton head over to Word Mill Games to learn about that system and these rules.With MythicGM you can use a simple command to ask questions and generate a response based from the the fate charts. You can even generate Random Events with it.## Commands```!MythicGM [<Odds> <Chaos Factor> [<Your Question>]]```By running the command with the arguments of Odds, Chaos Factor, and your question. The emulator with give you a response of Exceptional No, No, Yes, Exceptional Yes. As well generate random events.**Note:** By supplying no arguments you get this help file* `<Odds>` --  are the likly odds of your question. The odds are the following: Impossible, No Way, Very Unlikely, Unlikely, 50/50, Somewhat Likely, Likely, Very Likely, Near Sure Thing, A Sure Thing, Has To Be (**these values are not case sensitive.**)* `<Chaos Factor>` -- A chaos factor ranging from 1 to 9. The higher the number, the more likely a “yes” answer is and more unexpected events occur.* `<Your Question>` -- It's the question you would ask your normal GM like "Is that chest Trapped?" or "Is that NPC Hostile?". You can asked any question```!MythicEvent```By running the command it will generate a random event.```!MythicFocus```By running the command it will generate a random event focus.```!MythicAction```By running the command it will generate a random event action.```!MythicSubject```By running the command it will generate a random event subject.
